item.desc: DTaP=diphtheria, tetanus and acellular pertussis for children under 18 years of age; IPV=inactivated poliovirus; haemophilus influenzae type B for children under 5 years of age: combination given at 2, 4, 18 months and 4-6 years
item.name: TdP-IPV-Hib

item.desc: DTaP=diphtheria, tetanus and acellular pertussis for children under 18 years of age; IPV=inactivated poliovirus; Hib=haemophilus influenzae type B for children under 5 years of age: combination given at 2, 4, 18 months and 4-6 years
item.name: DTaP-IPV-Hib

item.desc: DIPHTHERIA-PERTUSSIS-POLIOMYELITIS-TETANUS (6 wks - 2 yrs)
item.name: DTaP-HBV-IPV-Hib

item.desc: DTaP=diphtheria, tetanus and acellular pertussis for children under 18 years of age; IPV=inactivated poliovirus
item.name: DTaP-IPV

item.desc: Hib=haemophilus influenzae type B for children under 5 years of age
item.name: Hib

item.desc: HIV = all pregnant women, opt out routine screening of all adults
item.name: HIV

item.desc: HepB screen= Hepatitis B serology (hep B sAg + anti-HBc or anti-HBs) in those with multiple sex partners, MSM, and injection drug users
item.name: HepB screen

item.desc: HepC screen = Hep C Ab serology in contacts of multiple sex partners, traumatic anal intercourse with infected person, IVDU
item.name: HepC screen

item.desc: VDRL = VDRL screening for syphillis; pregnant women at the first prenatal visit (and 3rd trimester and delivery high-risk groups), all sex workers, in correctional facilities, diagnosed with another STD, MSM with high-risk behaviors
item.name: VDRL

item.desc: Chlamydia = chlamydia urine PCR; sexually active women age 25 years or younger (including pregnant women), women older than 25 years with: new sex partner in prior 60 days, more than one sex partner, inconsistent condom use, unmarried, or history of STD; men: asymptomatic screening may or may not benefit
item.name: chlamydia

item.desc: ghonorrhea = ghonorrhea urine PCR in men with symptoms or asymptomatic women: Sexually active younger than 25 years, pregnancy, inconsistent condom use, multiple partners, partner with multiple contacts, sexual contact with partner with culture-proven STD, repeated episodes of STD, Sex work or drug use
item.name: ghonorrhea PCR

item.desc: Pneu-C=pneumococcal 7-valent conjugate
item.name: Pneu-C

item.desc: MMR=measles, mumps and rubella
item.name: MMR

item.desc: MenC-C=meningocococcal C conjugate
item.name: MenC-C

item.desc: VZ=varicella zoster
item.name: VZ

item.desc: Hep B=Hepatitis B
item.name: HepB

item.desc: dTap=diphtheria, tatanus and acellular pertussis adult/adolescent formulation
item.name: dTap

item.desc: Td=tetanus and diphtheria adult type formulation
item.name: Td

item.desc: Flu=influenza vaccine
item.name: Flu

item.desc: Hep A=Hepatitis A
item.name: HepA

item.desc: Hep AB=Hepatitis AB
item.name: HepAB

item.desc: Women ages of 9 and 26 years are recommended to receive human papillomavirus vaccine
item.name: HPV Vaccine

item.desc: Fecal Occult Blood Test
item.name: FOBT

item.desc: H1N1 Vaccination
item.name: H1N1

item.name: OtherA

item.desc: Other Layout B
item.name: OtherB
